org.jamesframework.ext.permutation

Class PermutationProblem<DataType extends IntegerIdentifiedData>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamesframework.core.problems.AbstractProblem<PermutationSolution,DataType>
      • org.jamesframework.ext.permutation.PermutationProblem<DataType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DataType - data type of the permutation problem, required to implement the IntegerIdentifiedData interface
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Problem<PermutationSolution>

    public class PermutationProblem<DataType extends IntegerIdentifiedData>
extends AbstractProblem<PermutationSolution,DataType>
    Generic permutation problem. Requires that every item in the data set is identified with a unique integer ID. The solution type is fixed to PermutationSolution so that a permutation is coded as an ordered sequence of these IDs. The data type can be any class or interface that implements/extends the IntegerIdentifiedData interface which imposes the assignment of IDs to items in the data set.
    Author:
    Herman De Beukelaer

    • Method Detail

      • createRandomSolution

        public PermutationSolution createRandomSolution()
        Create a random permutation solution. The IDs of all items are retrieved from the underlying data specified at construction and shuffled to create a random permutation.
        Returns:
        randomly generated permutation solution
